metadata.title: CVE-2022-26128 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-preview 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
A buffer overflow vulnerability exists in FRRouting through 8.1.0 due to awrong check on the input packet length in the babel_packet_examin functionin babeld/message.c.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-26128` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

frr - 8.1-1ubuntu1
frr-pythontools - 8.1-1ubuntu1
frr-rpki-rtrlib - 8.1-1ubuntu1
frr-snmp - 8.1-1ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: frr package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '8.1-1ubuntu1').
